CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 16, 1953, pg. 4 reads: "Pittsburgh Postmaster Joins NAACP - The first person enrolled in the 1953 NAACP membership drive by the national Alliance of Postal Employees' team was Postmaster James C. Smith. This team has since been working hard to meet its high quota among Pittsburgh postal employes.  Those shown with Mr. Smith, center, include Charles P. Vivrette, president of the local chapter of NAPE; Frederick D. Lee, captain of the team; Cicero Griffith, co-captain, and John G. Jones, a postal clerk and treasurer of the Pittsburgh branch of the NAACP. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of postal employees, from left: Charles P. Vivrette, Frederick D. Lee, James C. Smith receiving NAACP membership pin, Cicero Griffith, and John G. Jones, posed in office with certificates on wall from American Legion and Ambassadors Club
